intro: Cremanthodium heterocephalum, commonly known as the variable-headed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, arid conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
